name: Warlock
description: A Warlock makes pacts with otherworldly creatures in exchange for power.

body.name: Ability Proficiencies (New)
body.body:
In Dekatreis, Warlocks are more common than in other settings due to the ease at which other creatures can influence the world. As such, people from all walks of life can dip into pacts with such creatures.

When you gain your 1st level in Warlock, you may choose Intelligence or Wisdom, instead of Charisma, to use for all your class abilities. In addition, the multiclass requirement changes from 13 Charisma to whichever ability score you chose. Once this option has been chosen, it cannot be changed at later levels.

body.name: Eldritch Blast (New)
body.body:
Warlocks can innately cast Eldritch Blast at will, and the multiple beam scaling is based on their Warlock level only, not their total level.

Special Note: Eldritch Blast has been removed from the Warlock spell list, making it inaccessable from feats such as Magic Initiate.

body.name: Hex (New)
body.body:
Warlocks can innately cast Hex once per short rest, and the spell scaling is based on their Warlock level only, not their total level.

Special Note: Hex has been removed from the Warlock spell list, making it inaccessable from feats such as Magic Initiate.

additionalContent.name: Pact Boons
items:
You learn the find familiar spell and can cast it as a ritual without material components. The spell doesn’t count against your number of spells known.
When you cast the spell, you can choose one of the normal forms for your familiar or one of the following special forms: imp, pseudodragon, quasit, sprite, or tressym.
Additionally, this familiar gains the benefit of being able to attack on its turn, but it loses its multiattack action if it has one.

additionalContent.name: Eldritch Invocations
items: Your patron alters the curse you can place on creatures. Instead of necrotic damage, your Hex feature now deals force damage, as bolts of faerie magic strike at the cursed creature in tandem with your own strikes.

Your patron alters the curse you can place on creatures. Instead of necrotic damage, your Hex feature now deals fire damage, as fire erupts from the cursed creature's body, flickering with the glow of The Nine Hells each time you attack.

Your patron alters the curse you can place on creatures. Instead of necrotic damage, your Hex feature now deals psychic damage, as whispers of the outer planes invade the cursed creature's mind, driving it slowly to insanity with each blow.

Your patron alters the curse you can place on creatures. Instead of necrotic damage, your Hex feature now deals radiant damage, as a radiant glow envelops your target and consumes them with every hit.

Your patron alters the curse you can place on creatures. Instead of necrotic damage, your Hex feature now deals force damage, your curse allowing your attacks to dig into your target with the magical energy of your hexblade.
Pact of the Chain, Warlock Level 5th

Your familiar gains additional speed in their strikes. When they take the attack action on their turn, they may attack twice, instead of only once. Additionally, they gain 10 feet to their speed. If they have a flying speed or a climbing speed, they add this bonus to those as well.

Your familiar gains a portion of your energy and can use it to protect itself. Your summoned familiar gains a number of hitpoints equal to your Warlock level + your Charisma modifier. Additionally, they add your proficiency bonus to their AC.

sections.name: The Medusa Patron
sections.body:
Your patron is the monstrous Medusa, a powerful half-snake, half-human who has the ability to turn mortals into stone with a simple gaze. Unattached from legends that some might tell and the mortal beings that might take on her name, you know the truth about the part-snake goddess that resides in the plane of Shadowfell. Residing in the negative plane of the world, Medusa reaches out to budding, easily-manipulated adventurers that show potential to her, and over time manipulates them for her own cause, giving mortals a variety of whispers from the other plane and quests of questionable morality.

Medusa's followers may belong to a larger cult, or perhaps they may find themselves better off alone, knowing just what Medusa herself desires of her Warlocks. Most prominently, Medusa seems to call on her cultists in bouts of blood-boiling vengeance and jealousy. She subtly monitors the mortal plane from her residence in Shadowfell, and once she sets her serpent gaze on something, she sends an augury to mortals to deal with. This could be destroying the beauty of a fae forest, or it could perhaps be slaying a former follower of Medusa for turning their back on her power. Nonetheless, Medusa's followers should be wary of their patron, for once they're loyal to her, a lapse in loyalty could mean their own head.

sections.name: Expanded Spell List
sections.body:
Medusa allows you to choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.
1st Level: Inflict Wounds, Ray of Sickness
2nd Level: Alter Self, Maximilian's Earthen Grasp
3rd Level: Bestow Curse, Meld into Stone
4th Level: Stoneskin, Phantasmal Killer
5th Level: Creation, Contagion

sections.name: Serpent Servant
sections.body:
Starting at 1st level, Medusa graces you with a poisonous snake to aid you in your journey, and make sure that you are performing her will as obligated. This poisonous snake always obeys your commands, which you can give telepathically while it is within 100 feet of you. While on your person, the snake can't be targeted by any attack or other harmful effect; only you can cast spells on it; it can't take damage; and it is incapacitated.

Additionally, you and the snake have the following benefits:
• As an action, you can see through the snake's eyes and hear what it hears while it is within 100 feet of you.
• In combat, you roll initiative for the snake if it is not on your person. Otherwise, it remains incapacitated until otherwise given instructions to do so. Your snake cannot attack, but it can use all other actions as normal if it is capable of doing so. If it is slain by a creature, your attacks do an additional 1d6 poison damage to the killer for the next 1 minute.
• The snake doesn't require sleep. While it is within 100 feet of you, it can awaken you from sleep as a bonus action.
• The snake vanishes when it dies, if you die, or if the two of you are separated by more than 5 miles. At the end of a short or long rest, you can perform a 5 minute ritual calling upon Medusa to bring your snake back to you--no matter where it is or whether it died--and it reappears within 5 feet of you.

If you later gain the Pact of the Chain boon, you may make this snake your pact animal and it maintains all the above benefits as well as any benefits of the pact boon itself. In addition, while it is touching you, you gain blindsight with a range of 10 feet and proficiency in Intimidation and Persuasion checks. If you already have proficiency in these abilities, you gain expertise in them instead.

sections.name: Medusa's Gaze
sections.body:
At 6th level, you have inherited Medusa's signature ability to turn flesh into stone. As an action when your snake is on your shoulder, you can morph your face into a twisted, disgusting resemblance of Medusa herself. Each creature that has attacked you in the last or current round must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or else be petrified for a number of rounds up to your Charisma modifier. This has no effect on constructs or undead, and non-humanoids have advantage on this saving throw. After using this feature, you become unable to use it again until the end of a long rest.

Once you have used this feature, your face morphs back into the shape it once was, but your eyes remain serpentine and your hair sprouts snake-like appendages. You then automatically fail all Charisma based checks except for Intimidation until you take a long rest, at which point your appearance returns to normal.

sections.name: Snake Poison
sections.body: At 10th level, Medusa grants your spells and weapons a toxic benefit. Whenever you hit with a melee spell attack or melee weapon attack while your snake is within 5 feet of you, the attack deals an additional 1d8 + your Charisma modifier in poison damage.

sections.name: Medusa's Underling
sections.body: When you reach 14th level, Medusa has permanently taken possession of your soul and enchanted it with Shadowfell protection. You have resistance to poison damage, and whenever you use your Medusa's Gaze feature, you gain temporary hitpoints equal to your Charisma modifier + your Warlock level.
